intro: Citrosma brasiliensis, commonly known as Brazilian citronella, is a small evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically harvested when they are fully mature. Its leaves contain essential oils that have been used in traditional medicine and as a natural insect repellent. Due to its ecological importance and medicinal potential, it is a subject of interest in botanical research.
